Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: susanedee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overpriced - Rooms are small, noisy and HOT. The hotel would not let us use the air conditioning. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “so different from the website...”
Reviews.Author: stephLondon_uk
Reviews.Content: To be honest our disappointment was mainly because of the price. Had the double room been less than 50euros we wouldn't have complained. But we paid 180euros for a mini double room that was clearly not looked after, the wallpaper was coming off, the bathroom had dirt in between the tiles. One cheap push-on hand soap. Wireless internet wasn't working properly so useless. It's definitely not worth 3 stars and the most you should pay for a double room is 50euros, don't expect anything nice or welcoming, just a place to sleep one night or too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Marjak57
Reviews.Content: To find a room in the historic district at this price is great. Definitely not what North Americans expect from hotels (really really small)but for a Euopean budget hotel it is great. Breakfast in the AM is a nice touch and gets you on your way (no more, no less but hey what did you expect?). Rooms are clean and the air conditioning works. Internet is a little slow but it's free & works. What realy makes it is the guy on the front desk. He is great. Friendly helpful and a great sense of humour. I have recommended this place to several friends. after all I did not go to Rome to check out the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Why don't you try another hotel?”
Reviews.Author: azertyrome
Reviews.Content: I checked in the Augustus Hotel on the hottest day of July. The first night went allright except that the breakfast was really not worth mentionning. I was then moved to a different rooom on the second night and this is where the problems began. The room smelled terrible. Also the AC unit was bust and shut down on its own every 10 min. The night shift guy could not speak a word of English and was not at all sympathetic nor helpful. I was told the next day by the manager that the problem was due to excessive heat and had nothing to do with the hotel ("Excuse me!!?!?!"), therefore my request for a significant discount was rejected. Well, that was not his exact words. It would be too rude to mention them on this review. My advice is: do yourself a favour and go to a different hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people, confortable and nice atmosphere :)”
Reviews.Author: lunaii
Reviews.Content: We went toRome a group of High School's students to spent 4 days in February 2010. The hotel Augustus was very nice, goods rooms, has friendly staff and we felt like at home. It has free internet, and breakfast service:) for free Close to the bus 62, 60 and 63 that takes you to all around Rome. I would recomend it to everyone. From Ubrique, Cádiz

Reviews.Title: “good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: evilyeti
Reviews.Content: Hotel Augustus was a bit surprising at first – as it’s located on the complete second floor of a historical building on piazza Fiume. At first I was puzzled, as I’ve expected to see a reception on the entry level. There is one directly after the entrance on the second floor. Once we’ve reached it – things came back to normal – the room was clean and visibly new. There was a PC in the room with a hybrid LCD display – playing the role of a wall-mounted TV and the computer monitor at the same time. For non-techies finding your way through the remove might take a while though. :) The bed was very comfortable; breakfast was delivered in the room every morning on a pre-defined point in time (6:30-9:30). Ask the guy at the reception to set this for you the previous evening. Bathroom was clean and new, although a bit small. The room was nicely decorated (with Michelangelo replica poster) and had a direct view into the ruins located in the middle of piazza Fiume. When closed – the windows provided perfect isolation from the street noise, generated by the otherwise busy traffic. Transport connectivity is quite good – there is a Metro stop 10 minutes away and Termini station is only 3 stops of all 6 different busses stopping 50 meters from the building on via Piava. We’ve stayed there for 7 nights and we’ve enjoyed the stay. Something definitely worth mentioning is the exceptionally friendly staff. The guy there was always available to give us advice on where to buy and additional suitcase from, where to have nice dinner in a romantic place at a decent price, what would be the most optimal route to take in order to visit 5 different places the same day, which buses or other transport to take to get to a certain place, where not to shop, what is a reasonable price for the local ceramics, etc. It was exceptionally useful when he called us on the mobile phone roughly 15 minutes after we’ve left, to notify us about the keys and the mobile phone we’ve forgotten on the way home. I rushed back to collect them before going to the airport. There are a number of great restaurants around - one pizzaria directly on the opposite side of the Piave street made the best lasagna we've had there. A small restaurant called "il Rifugio del Buttero" provided the best Napoli-style pizzas and other delicious Italian kitchen samples. Of course you can always argue that the breakfast is the same every morning and that there are not gym and swimming pool in place, but practically looking – all we were looking for was a nice place to spend the nights at, at a decent price and ideally at a walking distance from the center. This is what we’ve got. Augustus met those expectations quite well. It is by far not luxurious, but a very good deal for the money which I can recommend if you’re going to Rome for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the welcome”
Reviews.Author: sashazDivonne
Reviews.Content: November 26, 2007. I have just returned from Rome where I spent 6 wonderful days. I stayed at Augustus, a very enjoyable place where I had breakfasts in bed while marveling at the ancient Roman ruins right under my window. The room was spotless clean and quiet especially at night time. It had plazma TV with an easy and free-of-charge access to the Net. But what is the best feature about the hotel is its location, in the middle of everything and within walking distance. And finally a few words of praise for the staff, especially, Romano. I dont know what I would have done without their help and excellent knowledge of the city. They go out of their way to try to help a lone traveler, like me, who cannot but feel lost in a not-so-tourist friendly city like Rome. Thank you, Romano. One last word, about the price. I found this hotel thru comparing prices on the Internet offered by various travel agencies. Then I called the hotel directly and asked if they could accommodate me at the lowest price I could find, and they did. The only negative comment I can make, I wish the morning croissants could be fresh, not those commercial cellophane wrapped pieces of sweet bread. Elena, FRANCE

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: toreroKnoxville
Reviews.Content: When we first entered the building, I thought I was on candid camera. My second thought was that I had been scammed. There is zero resemblance of a hotel, either from the outside or the entryway. A lobby does not exist. The entryway is in shambles and I would recommend wearing a hard hat. The hotel is on the second floor of a commercial building. A couple positive points. One friendly english speaking desk person in the afternoon. The one at night fills the hallway with cigarette smoke. The room was clean and relatively spacious. The internet connection was a plus. The bed was satisfactory. We did enjoy the air conditioning and natural light. Great restaurant recommendation. A few negative points. Breakfast was sort of a joke. After dodging a few cars and scooters to a cafe across the street, our morning hunger was only halfway satisfied with a pastry and capuccino. The neighborhood is not the best, neither for location nor for security. People traffic could be heard at all times going up and down the hallway and car traffic as well. The bathroom was okay, but good luck bending over to wash your feet in the shower. Overall, I would prefer a hotel...with a lobby and where all the floors in the building were filled with other hotel guests, not god knows who else. I would not recommend this place to a family member, friend, or even my least favorite coworker.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: loboscor
Reviews.Content: We booked this through a last minute travel agency in the Termini station. When we went to inspect the room, the front desk person was extremely rude to me and my wife. They placed us in a room in the hotel next door. The bathroom was disgusting.... filled with mildew. PLEASE do not stay here. Trust me. A better option is "Pensione Paradise". I will post photos of the mildew on a separate post. When I mentioned the mildew problem to the front desk, they told me it looks fine and they did not see a problem. They said it was a plumbing problem?

Reviews.Title: “horrible.”
Reviews.Author: jogocaar
Reviews.Content: I found the entrance to the hotel, completely inapropiate and durty for a 3th class hotel. The hot water didn´t work, !how can this happen nowadays¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡. I couldn´t have a proper shower in the 3 days I stayed there. The paper on the wall was falling down, wich gave the impresion of a very old room. I forgot a mp3 player in the room, and I phoned the next day to recover it. The man in the recepcion said he couldn´t speak english!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! IN A HOTEL IN ROME!!!!!!! So at the end I couldn´t recover it. If I had to go to rome againg this would be the last hotel to stay in. Thank you. My name is jose antonio gonzalez, and my e-mail is jogocaar@hotmail.com if you want more information about the hotel, you can contact me.

Reviews.Title: “not a luxury hotel...”
Reviews.Author: bex9993
Reviews.Content: The hotel we stayed in was close enough to the main sights and places we wanted to go. However, if I went again I would not go back. The room was clean enough, but the carpet had stains all over it. The pictures are extremely mis-leading, the front actually looks awful-really run-down. The staff were nice, but the rooms are very very close to reception, which I did not personally like as I felt it wasnt very private. Breakfast was nice, and you can go there most times of the day. There is a lift but I refused to use it as it looked like it would break any minute. It was ok value for money, but Id advise anyone to spend a bit more and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Liars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via the internet. When we arrived we were told that due to plumbing problems there is no room for us and we were transfered to an alternetive hotel. We were also told that the problem will be fixed tomorow and we will be able to check into our room the next day. When we came back the next day we were told (by another person) that there no rooms available (probably they over booked) and that person did not know anything about a "plumbing problem". We were offered a very low level room. I was not imprest with this and I do not like being lied to and I defently do not like when hotels overbook. I so not recommend this hotel at all

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Augustus Rome this is not a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this 'Hotel' for 3 nights from 9th February 2005, we feel that this was just a very basic room only with a reception not a Hotel. The first thing that struck us was if there was a fire there was no alternative way out only one way in and one way out. The grouting on the tiles on the shower floor was all broken up and gritty and if you tried to use the jacuzzi shower then the bathroom became a swimming pool. We had a voucher to get 'breakfast' in a cafe over a very busy road, the cafe was not very friendly and they made you feel very awkward as though you were trying to get something for nothing. The internet was so slow it was not worth using and the e-mail did not work at all. The room smelt musty all the time, but the bed was very clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: cjohcjoh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept 2004. Very small room compared to the other hotels we stayed at in Europe. The internet connection in the room was REALLY, REALLY slow - not worth your time. The direct line telephones can only receive calls - you cannot phone out and the safe was not operational. There is NO signage to indicate the hotel, only a handwritten 'Augustus' on the buzzer outside - not even the cab driver heard of the hotel and it's located in a "loft" type building with other businesses, such as a hairdresser and some residents on the other floors - Yes the hotel is actually on the 2nd floor of this building. The entrance and the ancient gated elevator leave little to be desired. Breakfast is not in the hotel, but in a cafe across the busy road. The sheets are not changed on a daily basis and we continually had to ask for toilet paper. The place wasn't bad (although the carpets needed cleaning), but the service was great. This hotel is not suited for persons with 5 star tastes - it's much more suited for persons with 1 - 2 star taste.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Augustus
HotelInfo.Address: Via Piave 61 2nd floor, 00187 Rome, Italy
